Comment: By Billal Rahman - Immigration Reporter:   A California man was on his way to pick up his children to take them to school in Manteca, around 70 miles east of San Francisco, when he was stopped by two unmarked vehicles.  What unfolded next was a moment of disbelief and fear that shattered a family and left them searching for answers.  [Juan Alejandro Munoz, 38, was detained](https://www.newsweek.com/father-detained-ice-drivers-license-2056696) by Immigration and Customs Enforcement ([ICE](https://www.newsweek.com/topic/ice)) agents on 19 February. His wife, Suri Ibarra, 36, told *Newsweek* she is devastated after his detention.  Read more: [https://www.newsweek.com/california-man-juan-alejandro-munoz-detained-ice-school-2063451](https://www.newsweek.com/california-man-juan-alejandro-munoz-detained-ice-school-2063451)
